group.text: DAWN 1.6 contains many new features, and bug fixes; below are some of the main ones.

• New UI for the Region Editor: TableViewer replaced by a TreeViewer in order to support other ROIs (only lines and box were supported in the previous one) and various bug fixes for value editing, updates, etc.
• New ROI interfaces (backward compatible additions) available.
• Jython linespace and logspace bug fixes.
• All ROIs made by regions are now named.

• Renamed ADataset interface to Dataset and recommend using Dataset.FLOAT64 etc instead of AbstractDataset.FLOAT64, with a plan to migrate slowly over to using Dataset and its new factory class instead of AbstractDataset and add a CompoundDataset sub-interface too.
• Implemented an algorithm for identifying bad frames in processed data (eg. radiation damage) for exclusion from the final averaging stage in NCD.
• Calculate true SAXS invariant value instead of total scattered intensity using Porod fit data.
• Powder integration tool which allows 2D powder images to be reduced to 1D data (~ 10 fps) if a calibrated nexus file is supplied.
• Image integration routines can also be called from Jython.
